common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues Across Multiple Applications
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting various applications (VS Code, Desktop app, Chrome/Edge extensions) to Pieces OS.  Common symptoms include connection hangs, leaks, and inability to register MCP tools.  Suggested solutions include checking Pieces OS and app versions, verifying network configurations (VPN, proxy), monitoring connections, restarting Pieces OS or the affected application, and ensuring correct MCP server configuration in affected applications.

related_issues.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
related_issues.text:
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Pieces MCP server fails to properly integrate with Claude Code within VSCode. While the SSE endpoint responds initially, it hangs indefinitely, preventing MCP tools from being registered or used. This affects Claude Code integration both as a standalone CLI and when used within VS Code.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install Pieces OS and Pieces app
2. Login in the app
3. Configure MCP in Claude Code's ~/.claude.json:

```json
{
  "pieces": {
    "type": "sse",
    "url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse"
}
```

4. Attempt to use Pieces MCP tools (e.g., mcp__pieces__ask_pieces_ltm) in Claude Code
5. Tools are not available despite server being configured
6. Same issue occurs whether using Claude Code in terminal or integrated with VS Code

**Technical Details:**
- SSE endpoint (http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse) responds with:

```
event: endpoint
data: /model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages
```

- Connection then hangs indefinitely (SSE buffering issue)
- Both Pieces OS and Pieces app processes are running
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Issues with Copying, Sharing, and Dragging Files in Pieces OS 12.1.1
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with copying code blocks (inline vs. inter-line discrepancies), sharing snippets via links or GitHub gists, and dragging files into the conversation context.  Additional issues include file choosing window behavior and file filtering limitations.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and implement appropriate fixes.

related_issues.title: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
related_issues.text: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !! ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. 1. The 2nd pic below do not function properly: The description of this problem only requires one line equation, and inequality of graphics: - it should be: Copy copilot message ≠ Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) = Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) - however: = ≠ - how could Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) ? absolute wrong. - it should be like: Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) by design. 2. Copy improperly: if one copies `in-line code block` through ctrl+c (rather than the "copy button" provided alongside), it is very likely (coupled with double click) to paste it into " ￼ ". 3. Feature: Hopefully, the `in-line code block` can be partially copied (rather than merely allowing all copies) like the inter-line code block to improve efficiency. common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and OS: Missing Platform Directory and Connection Leaks
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces Desktop and OS on Windows.  OS logs show "MissingPlatformDirectoryException(Unable to get application documents directory)" errors, preventing application startup.  Additionally, Pieces Desktop exhibits a connection leak, creating excessive connections to the OS server.  Suggested workarounds include restarting the machine, monitoring connections, and closing Pieces Desktop. Contact support if issues persist.

related_issues.title: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening
related_issues.text: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hi guys! I want to try a "Pro" plan, however the modal with payment is not opening and the button "Upgrade Now" turns to "Awaiting checkout..." and nothing happens. I've tried through the Desktop App, Pieces OS app - neither helped. Could you please advice? Default Browser: Arc (if it helps) PiecesOs Log Attached [log-08102025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21704376/log-08102025.txt) Pieces for Developers log string: ``` [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_button [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: true [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: PiecesProInformationDialog [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream, PiecesProInformationDialog] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_upgrade_to_pro_button [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: /workstream [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 ``` Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

common_issues.title: Users unable to upgrade to Pieces Pro
common_issues.description: Multiple users on Windows and macOS are reporting issues upgrading to Pieces Pro. The checkout process fails, with the upgrade button displaying "Awaiting checkout..." or a blank checkout page with zero values.  This has been ongoing for several weeks for some users.  The Pieces extension for Chrome and Edge also has connectivity issues with Pieces OS, potentially related.

related_issues.title: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening
related_issues.text: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hi guys! I want to try a "Pro" plan, however the modal with payment is not opening and the button "Upgrade Now" turns to "Awaiting checkout..." and nothing happens. I've tried through the Desktop App, Pieces OS app - neither helped. Could you please advice? Default Browser: Arc (if it helps) PiecesOs Log Attached [log-08102025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21704376/log-08102025.txt) Pieces for Developers log string: ``` [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_button [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: true [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: PiecesProInformationDialog [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream, PiecesProInformationDialog] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_upgrade_to_pro_button [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: /workstream [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 ``` Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. related_issues.text:
Unable to upgrade subscription

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Every time I click "Upgrade" from ANYWHERE - to upgrade to pro, it leads to a page that is blank except for a minimal table, like the bones of a cart checkout view, with like price, subtotal, total, etc. except there are no words, and all the values are 0.00 (zero dollars).. it stays like this for a minute, then says it isn't working properly and returns to the desktop view or the view I was in before. 

been happening for weeks

common_issues.title: LTM performance degrades over time and becomes unusable
common_issues.description: Users report that the LTM functionality degrades over time, eventually becoming unresponsive to queries.  This occurs on macOS after several weeks of use. Clearing LTM data through the provided button does not resolve the issue.  Reinstalling the application temporarily restores LTM functionality.  Users experience this issue repeatedly.

related_issues.title: LTM gets gunged up over time
related_issues.text:
LTM gets gunged up over time
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

related_issues.title: I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
related_issues.text:
I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.

macOS

When using Pieces I asked, "what did I work today?" and I received an error that says `I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.`  When I have paid for pro and am signed in. What I expect is that I can use my paid pro membership to run query and not receive an error.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the 'MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs' issue (ticket #810) due to its high activity level and impact on Claude Code integration.
Investigate and address the recurring 'Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening' problem (ticket #825) affecting upgrades and potentially impacting revenue.
Troubleshoot issues with copying, sharing, and dragging files (tickets #821, #815, #822) to improve core user experience.
Address the 'MissingPlatformDirectoryException' error on Windows (ticket #813) hindering application startup.
Develop a comprehensive troubleshooting guide for connectivity issues between Pieces OS, Desktop, and extensions (tickets #819, #816).
Investigate and fix the LTM performance degradation issue (ticket #805) impacting long-term users.
Monitor and address the recurring inability to upgrade to Pieces Pro (ticket #808) to ensure smooth subscription upgrades.
